results.title: Don Juan
results.brief_description: Don Juan is a 1926 American romantic adventure film directed by Alan Crosland and starring John Barrymore. It is the first feature-length film to utilise the Vitaphone sound-on-disc sound system with a synchronised musical score and sound effects, though it has no spoken dialogue.

constellations_other.name: Sound and Hollywood
constellations_other.description: The impact of sound on Tinsel Town stretches from the beginning of cinema to recent award-winners, as well as the biggest band in K-Pop.

results.description: If there was one thing that Don Juan de Marana learned from his father Don Jose, it was that women gave you three things - life, disillusionment and death. In his father’s case it was his wife, Donna Isobel, and Donna Elvira who supplied the latter. Don Juan settled in Rome after attending the University of Pisa. Rome was run by the tyrannical Borgia family consisting of Caesar, Lucrezia and the Count Donati. Juan has his way with and was pursued by many women, but it is the one that he could not have that haunts him. It will be for her that he suffers the wrath of Borgia for ignoring Lucrezia and then killing Count Donati in a duel. For Adriana, they will both be condemned to death in the prison on the river Tigre.
description_for_label: If there was one thing that Don Juan de Marana learned from his father Don Jose, it was that women gave you three things - life, disillusionment and death. results.title: Don't Think I've Forgotten: Cambodia's Lost Rock and Roll
results.creator_credit: W-film, cine-connect, John Pirozzi and Andrew Pope
results.headline_credit: Cambodia, France and United States of America, 2014
results.brief_description: Through the eyes, words and songs of its popular music stars of the 50s, 60s, and 70s, Don’t Think I’ve Forgotten: Cambodia’s Lost Rock and Roll examines and unravels Cambodia’s tragic past, culminating in the genocidal Khmer Rouge’s dismantling of the society and murder of 2,000,000 of its citizens.

constellations_other.name: Bophana: cultural memory on film
constellations_other.description: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center is dedicated to the collection, preservation and presentation of audiovisual material related to Cambodia. Their collection includes archival footage, newsreels, documentaries, feature films, photographs and vinyl records.

results.title_for_label: Don’t Think I’ve Forgotten: Cambodia’s Lost Rock and Roll

results.title: Doing Time for Patsy Cline
results.creator_credit: John Winter, Louise Wakefield, Chris Kennedy, Roger Ford, Australian Film Finance Corporation, New South Wales Film & Television Office and Oilrag Productions
results.brief_description: Following a passion for country music, Ralph leaves his fatherâ€™s sheep farm in a remote Australian town, armed with a guitar and a plane ticket to Nashville, Tennessee. He hopes to hitchhike to Sydney Airport where his take-off into a successful country/western singing career will hopefully begin. However, fate and his naivety find him hitchhiking with a psychotic drug thief named Boyd, and Boyd’s mesmerising girlfriend, Patsy. The plot then splits into a series of parallels, flash forwards and flashbacks. One depicts Ralphâ€™s imprisonment after being framed for drug trafficking. The other follows the dramatic ascent of his career to hype status and the pairing between the dynamic Patsy and himself.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Winter, Louise Wakefield, Chris Kennedy, Roger Ford, Australian Film Finance Corporation, New South Wales Film & Television Office and Oilrag Productions

results.title: Dogtown and Z-Boys
results.creator_credit: Agi Orsi Productions, Vans (US), Stacy Peralta and Craig Stecyk
results.brief_description: This award-winning, thrilling story is about a group of discarded kids who revolutionized skateboarding and shaped the attitude and culture of modern day extreme sports. Featuring old skool skating footage, exclusive interviews and a blistering rock soundtrack, DOGTOWN AND Z-BOYS captures the rise of the Zephyr skateboarding team from Venice’s Dogtown, a tough “locals only” beach with a legacy of outlaw surfing.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Agi Orsi Productions, Vans (US), Stacy Peralta and Craig Stecyk

results.title: Dog Day Afternoon
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of would-be Brooklyn bank robbers John Wojtowicz and Salvatore Naturale. Sonny and Sal attempt a bank heist which quickly turns sour and escalates into a hostage situation and stand-off with the police. As Sonny’s motives for the robbery are slowly revealed and things become more complicated, the heist turns into a media circus.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

video_links.name: Dog Day Afternoon | Modern Trailer | HBO Max

results.title: Doctor Sleep
results.brief_description: Still irrevocably scarred by the trauma he endured as a child at the Overlook, Dan Torrance has fought to find some semblance of peace. But that peace is shattered when he encounters Abra, a courageous teenager with her own powerful extrasensory gift, known as the ‘shine’. Instinctively recognising that Dan shares her power, Abra has sought him out, desperate for his help against the merciless Rose the Hat and her followers.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

results.title: Do the Right Thing
results.creator_credit: 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Universal Pictures, Wynn Thomas, Spike Lee and Ruth E. Carter
results.brief_description: Do the Right Thing is a 1989 American comedy-drama film produced, written, and directed by Spike Lee. The story explores a Brooklyn neighbourhood’s simmering racial tension, which culminates in violence and a death on a hot summer day.

constellations_other.name: Into a World of Colour
constellations_other.description: Filmmakers have been using colour as a method of storytelling since the first moving pictures. Colour can be used to signify emotion, intensify drama or to create a strong visual aesthetic.

results.creator_credit_for_label: 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Universal Pictures, Wynn Thomas, Spike Lee and Ruth E. Carter
results.description: Salvatore “Sal” Fragione is the Italian owner of a pizzeria in Brooklyn. A neighborhood local, Buggin’ Out, becomes upset when he sees that the pizzeria’s Wall of Fame exhibits only Italian actors. Buggin’ Out believes a pizzeria in a black neighborhood should showcase black actors, but Sal disagrees. The wall becomes a symbol of racism and hate to Buggin’ Out and to other people in the neighborhood, and tensions rise.
description_for_label: Salvatore “Sal” Fragione is the Italian owner of a pizzeria in Brooklyn. results.title: Dizzy Dishes
results.brief_description: The Fleischer’s Talkartoon short that debuted the now infamous Betty Boop.

constellations_other.name: Timeless early animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation traces the inspirations and evolution of the Cuphead animation technique and franchise back to the early 20th century and beyond.

results.description: The Fleischer’s Talkartoon short that debuted the now infamous Betty Boop.

results.title: Division 4
results.brief_description: A police drama based on the fictional Melbourne suburb of Yarra Central.
results.description: A police drama based on the fictional Melbourne suburb of Yarra Central.

results.title: Disturbia
results.creator_credit: Paramount, Cold Spring Pictures, DreamWorks Pictures, The Montecito Picture Company, Tom Pollock, E. Bennett Walsh, Joe Medjuck, D. J. Caruso, Marie-Sylvie Deveau, Tom Southwell, Christopher Landon, Carl Ellsworth, Jackie Marcus Schaffer and Kwame Parker
results.brief_description: Disturbia is a teen update of Alfred Hitchcock’s classic Rear Window starring Shia LeBouf.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Paramount, Cold Spring Pictures, DreamWorks Pictures, The Montecito Picture Company, Tom Pollock, E. Bennett Walsh, Joe Medjuck, D. J. Caruso, Marie-Sylvie Deveau, Tom Southwell, Christopher Landon, Carl Ellsworth, Jackie Marcus Schaffer and Kwame Parker
results.description: Kale is a 17-year-old placed under house arrest after punching his teacher. He is confined to his house, and decides to use his free time spying on his neighbors. Things start to get weird when guests enter the Turner’s house and don’t come back out. Kale and his friends, Ronnie and Ashley, start to grow more and more interested in what is actually happening within the house of Robert Turner.
